ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I developed an understanding and appreciation for international law.
I learned a great deal about international law, legal thinking, and the way in which the US government deliberates upon legal conundrums.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The course was really interesting and Oona is a great professor. However, I think the course attempt to cover too much material, resulting in the teaching feeling rushed and not enough time spent to fully flush out discussions. Certain lectures, such as the ones on international law theories, could have been condensed, which would have allowed room for more interesting and relevant material.

I really enjoyed this course. I think that it was well organized and that the included material was well considered for the most part. I would have appreciated a course packet I could buy though. Keeping track of all the readings was difficult.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes. It's a great introductory course to international law.
I would recommend this course to another student because I think it provides a strong foundation to understand international law.
